block.p: Ilana Gusta Roth, a daughter of Prof. and Mrs. Byron M. Roth of Orlean, Va., was married at their home yesterday to Victor Escandon, a son of Yvonne Timm Escandon of San Antonio and Dr. Roberto Escandon Dominguez of Mexico City. Judge Dudley Payne Jr. of the Juvenile Domestic Relations Court of Fauquier County, Va., officiated.

Mrs. Roth Escandon, 29, graduated from Tulane University and received an M.B.A. last month from New York University. In September, she is to become a sales associate for institutional stocks at Merrill Lynch & Company in New York. Her father is a professor of social psychology, on leave from Dowling College in Oakdale, N.Y. Her mother, Doris E. Roth, is a land-use lawyer and counsel to McMillan, Rather, Bennett & Rigano, a law firm in Melville, N.Y.

Ilana Gusta Roth, a daughter of Prof. and Mrs. Byron M. Roth of Orlean, Va., was married at their home yesterday to Victor Escandon, a son of Yvonne Timm Escandon of San Antonio and Dr. Roberto Escandon Dominguez of Mexico City. Judge Dudley Payne Jr. of the Juvenile Domestic Relations Court of Fauquier County, Va., officiated.

Mrs. Roth Escandon, 29, graduated from Tulane University and received an M.B.A. last month from New York University. In September, she is to become a sales associate for institutional stocks at Merrill Lynch & Company in New York. Her father is a professor of social psychology, on leave from Dowling College in Oakdale, N.Y. Her mother, Doris E. Roth, is a land-use lawyer and counsel to McMillan, Rather, Bennett & Rigano, a law firm in Melville, N.Y.

Mr. Escandon, 33, is a director of business development at MoneyTran, a start-up company in New York for electronic payment and settlements services. He graduated from Boston University and received an M.B.A. and a master's degree in international studies from the University of Pennsylvania. His mother retired as a nurse in the San Antonio public schools. His father, a retired urologist, practiced in Mexico City.
